question:
From below what are the properties of
concave mirrors?
option_1: Converging mirrors and form real and inverted image in front of the mirror
option_2: Diverging mirrors and form virtual and upright image behind the mirror.
option_3: Converging mirrors and form virtual and inverted image in front of the mirror.
option_4: Diverging mirrors and form real and inverted image in front of the mirror.
Subject: Physics
correct_answer: Converging mirrors and form real and inverted image in front of the mirror

question:
A ray \( O P \) of monochromatic light is
incident on the face \( A B \) of prism
\( A B C D \) near vertex \( B \) at an incident
angle of \( 60^{\circ} \) (see figure). If the refractive
index of the material of the prism is \( \sqrt{3} \) which of the following is (are) correct?
This question has multiple correct options
option_1: The ray gets totally internally reflected at face \( C D \)
option_2: The ray comes out through face \( A D \)
option_3:
The angle between the incident ray and the emergent
ray is 90
option_4: The angle between the incident ray and the emergent ray is \( 120^{\circ} \)
Subject: Physics
correct_answer: The ray gets totally internally reflected at face \( C D \)
